result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. GOESSL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L. GOESSL

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 02-19-2016

The State moves to withdraw the Information and to amend count 1 to disorderly conduct, contrary to section 947.01(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, battery.  Motion granted.
Sentence Withheld.  Defendant is placed on probation to DOC for twelve (12) months.
Conditions of probation:
1) No contact with Lori Neuman;
2) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
3) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
4) complete fifty (50) hours of community service;
5) spend thirty (30) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agents discretion and upon order of the court.
Court costs are waived.
Victim Impact Statement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. 
Minutes.

Pretrial conference is set for 02-19-15 at 11:00 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 02-23-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 3 position.
Plea date is set for 12-17-14 at 3:30 p.m.
Status Conference scheduled for 11-18-2014 @ 10:00 a.m. BR-1.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-05-14 at 4:00 p.m.  
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-06-14 at 2:45 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of strangulation and suffocation and battery.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Lori Neuman, Julie Neuman, Carla Schmidlkofer, Vonseal Otto and Westfield Bar at 1710 Western Avenue, Manitowoc, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
